text: i think the reason a lot of people come
to hbs is to figure out what they're
passionate about i think if you
necessarily knew in advance
you might not come here um and i think
that that was something i was scared of
was that everyone was gonna know exactly
what they wanted to do and i was going
to be this person who was trying to
figure out and i would get lost in the
mix and
not know what classes to take and not
know what club shouldn't be involved in
and not know
what competitions to get involved with
and i think that's totally untrue i
think that everyone or a lot of people
are trying to figure out what makes them
most happy and what they're most
passionate about and then the ones that
actually do know that are more than
willing to share their knowledge and
import their knowledge on you and so um
not knowing what you is that you want to
do i think is like totally acceptable at
hbs coming here
i wasn't sure if i was going to go back
to finance or not and i think i quickly
realized once at hbs that i wasn't going
to go back to finance i think i want to
create things and seeing all the amazing
things people do here and have done here
and want to do here
[Music]
made me feel like what i was doing in
finance wasn't fulfilling enough for me
and that no matter how much money you
make if it's not personally fulfilling
that it's not enough
i watched classmates build things and
start companies and
i definitely caught that bug from being
here
but i'm going to work at an established
startup this summer just to get some
idea of actually what it's like to work
at a place like that and
lean resources and something that'll be
very different from what i did before
but i think um much more rewarding um
to who i am
i think since i've been here i've
realized that i'm good at
getting things done and more of an
executor than a dreamer so i look
forward to finding the dreamer in my
classmates and i'll continue to be the
executor i think the idea of working for
yourself and
is really is the dream that i have
essentially
and that's my story
